annotations.caption: The front of the LKR 20 note showcases a vibrant depiction of the Port of Colombo, blending modern and historical views. The Sri Lanka Serendib Scops Owl and the Baronet butterfly enhance its charm. Predominant Color: Maroon.

On the reverse, a Ves Netuma Dancer performs beside a Geta Bera Drummer, embodying traditional Sri Lankan culture. The Punkalasa symbolizes prosperity, while the Liya Vela floral motif adds elegance. Predominant Color: Maroon.

The LKR 50 note features the Manampitiya Bridge, juxtaposed with the historic bridge. Above, a subtle outline of a railway arch bridge enhances its significance. The Sri Lankan Dull Blue Flycatcher and the Blue Oakleaf butterfly complete the scene. Predominant Color: Blue.
The back presents a Vadiga Patuna Dancer, accompanied by a Yakbera drummer, celebrating Sri Lankan heritage. The Punkalasa guard-stone and Liya Vela motif enrich the design. Predominant Color: Blue.

The LKR 100 note illustrates the Norochcholai Coal Power Plant, paired with the Laxapana waterfall, symbolizing energy and nature. The Sri Lankan Orange Billed Babbler and Autumn Leaf butterfly add vibrancy. Predominant Color: Orange.

On the reverse, a Mridangam drummer plays alongside a Bharatanatyam dancer, showcasing artistic heritage. The Naga guard-stone and the Dvithva Liya Vela floral design enhance its cultural richness. Predominant Color: Orange.

The LKR 500 note features the World Trade Center towers and the Bank of Ceylon building in Colombo. To the right, the ancient Lankathilake Viharaya temple adds historical depth. The Sri Lankan Emerald Collared Parakeet and Ceylon Indigo Royal butterfly enhance the beauty. Predominant Color: Purple.

The reverse depicts a Thelme Netuma dancer and a Yak Bera drummer, celebrating traditional performance arts. The Padmanidhi guard-stone and the Dvithva Liya Vela floral motif add to its artistic flair. Predominant Color: Purple.

At the forefront of the LKR 1000 note, the newly constructed Ramboda tunnel is featured, flanked by a depiction of the former rock wall. The Sri Lankan Hanging Parrot and White Four Ring butterfly contribute to the lively design. Predominant Color: Green.

The back illustrates a Daul Bera drummer alongside a Malpadaya Netuma dancer, capturing the essence of cultural celebration. A guardian deityâ€™s guard-stone and the Dvithva Liya Vela floral design enhance its beauty. Predominant Color: Green.

The LKR 5000 note features a Nagaraksha and Guruluraksha dancer, symbolizing the rich cultural heritage of Sri Lanka. The Rathnaprasadaya guard-stone and Kalpavrksha floral design further accentuate its elegance. Predominant Color: Gold.

On the reverse, the same Nagaraksha and Guruluraksha dancers are depicted, celebrating traditional dance. The Rathnaprasadaya guard-stone and Kalpavrksha floral design enhance the aesthetic appeal. Predominant Color: Gold.
